IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE SCHOOL STRIVES TO DEVELOP IN STUDENTS A LIFELONG LOVE OF LEARNING, RESPONSIBLE CITIZENSHIP AND PERSONAL INTEGRITY.
IRS990.MissionDesc: The Hotchkiss School strives to develop in students a lifelong love of learning, responsible citizenship, and personal integrity. We are a community based on trust, mutual respect, and compassion, and we hold all members of the community accountable for upholding these values.
IRS990.Desc: THE SCHOOL is committed to MASTERY OF LEARNING SKILLS, DEVELOPMENT OF INTELLECTUAL CURIOSITY, excellence and creativity in all disciplines, AND enthusiastic participation in athletics and other school activities. we ENCOURAGE our STUDENTS TO DEVELOP CLARITY OF THOUGHT, CONFIDENCE AND FACILITY IN EXPRESSING IDEAS, and artistic and aesthetic sensitivity. we expect all MEMBERS OF THE COMMUNITY, in and out of the classroom, to subject their views and actions to critical examination and to accept responsibility for them. we hope that our graduates will leave hotchkiss with a commitment to service to others and to environmental stewardship, and with a greater understanding of themselves and of their responsibilities in a global society. THE ENROLLMENT FOR THE TAX YEAR WAS APPROXIMATELY 600 STUDENTS.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule A, Part II, Line 10, Explanation of Other Income:
Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: other income - 2011 Amount: $ 266,936. 2012 Amount: $ 364,218. 2013 Amount: $ 681,676. 2014 Amount: $ 367,666. 2015 Amount: $ 301,822. child care income - 2011 Amount: $ 191,523. 2012 Amount: $ 210,416. 2013 Amount: $ 237,151. 2014 Amount: $ 254,048. 2015 Amount: $ 290,470. fundraising proceeds - 2011 Amount: $ 55,550. 2012 Amount: $ 0. 2013 Amount: $ 0. 2014 Amount: $ 0. 2015 Amount: $ 0.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: the easement is part of a parcel of land purchased by the school in 2004. it had been created in the 1980's by the owner of the land at that point in time and the loss of economic value of the easement had been reflected in the appraised value of the parcel. this appraisal served as the basis of the purchase price. the land is reported on the School's statement of financial position at purchased cost.

INCOME FROM ENDOWMENT FUNDS IS DRAWN IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE SCHOOL'S SPENDING POLICY AND USED IN ACCORDANCE WITH DONOR-IMPOSED STIPULATIONS OR, IN THE ABSENCE THEREOF, TO SUPPORT THE SCHOOL'S GENERAL OPERATING EXPENSES, INCLUDING SALARIES, FINANCIAL AID AND FACILITIES MAINTENANCE.

THE SCHOOL ACCOUNTS FOR UNCERTAIN INCOME TAX PROVISIONS INCLUDED IN ACCOUNTING STANDARDS CODIFICATION ("ASC") 740. ASC 740 PRESCRIBES DETAILED GUIDANCE FOR FINANCIAL STATEMENT RECOGNITION, MEASUREMENT AND DISCLOSURE OF UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS RECOGNIZED IN AN ENTERPRISE'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. TAX POSITIONS MUST MEET A MORE-LIKELY-THAN-NOT RECOGNITION THRESHOLD TO BE RECOGNIZED. THERE ARE NO UNCERTAIN INCOME TAX POSITIONS AT JUNE 30, 2015 AND 2016. THE SCHOOL'S FEDERAL AND STATE INCOME TAX RETURNS PRIOR TO FISCAL 2013 ARE NO LONGER SUBJECT TO AUDIT.
COST OF GOODS SOLD 824,997. CHANGE IN VALUE OF INTEREST RATE SWAP AGREEMENT 2,513,680. CHANGE IN VALUE OF POST RETIREMENT BENEFIT OBLIGATION 5,669,445. CHANGE IN VALUE OF CRUTS 2,570,719.
the school publicizes the policy along with other area schools in the local newspaper.

AccountActivitiesOutsideUSGrp.RegionTxt: East Asia and the Pacific - Australia, Brunei, Burma, Cambodia,
Europe (Including Iceland & Greenland) - Albania, Andorra, Austria, Belgium
North America - Canada and Mexico, but not the United States
South America - Argentina, Bolivia, Brazil, Chile, Columbia, Ecuador,

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: INVESTMENTS INCLUDED IN THIS SECTION RELATE TO INVESTMENT HOLDINGS INCLUDED IN THE SCHOOL'S ENDOWMENT PORTFOLIO.

the hotchkiss school has dedicated an individual in the admissions office to work solely with financial aid. Financial aid awards are also tracked on an individual basis in the business office for billing purposes.

FOR THE BENEFIT AND CONVENIENCE OF THE SCHOOL AND AS A CONDITION OF THEIR EMPLOYMENT, CERTAIN EMPLOYEES ARE PROVIDED WITH ON-CAMPUS RESIDENCES AT THE SCHOOL'S EXPENSE. FOR THE CONVENIENCE OF THE SCHOOL, THESE RESIDENCES ARE READILY AVAILABLE AND USED FOR SCHOOL-RELATED ORDINARY AND NECESSARY BUSINESS FUNCTIONS ON A REGULAR AND CONTINUING BASIS. NONTAXABLE BENEFITS ALSO INCLUDE CERTAIN TUITION REMISSION AMOUNTS, IN ACCORDANCE WITH INTERNAL REVENUE CODE SECTION 117(D). AS STIPULATED IN THE OUTGOING HEAD OF SCHOOL'S EMPLOYMENT CONTRACT, CERTAIN TRAVEL AND ADVISORY EXPENSES ARE BORNE BY THE SCHOOL AND APPROPRIATELY REPORTED AS TAXABLE COMPENSATION TO THE INDIVIDUAL.
the amounts in part i, column (b) represent the number of contributions.
THE SCHOOL MAINTAINS AN ACCOUNT WITH A FINANCIAL INSTITUTION THROUGH WHICH GIFTS OF APPRECIATED SECURITIES ARE RECEIVED AND LIQUIDATED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Authority to approve the 990 is delegated to the Audit and risk Committee by the Board. the Audit and risk Committee reviews in detail with school management and its auditors. Copies of the 990 are then made available to all Trustees prior to filing.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: the CFO collects and reviews all completed forms, and then passes them on to the president and secretary of the board and to the head of school.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE HEAD OF SCHOOL AND PERIODICALLY THE BOARD'S COMMITTEE FOR ORGANIZATIONAL REVIEW AND NOMINATING REVIEW MARKET DATA FROM COMPARABLE INSTITUTIONS FOR THE TOP 20 OR SO PAID EMPLOYEES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: the school makes its governing documents, conflict of interest policies and financial statements available for public inspection upon request at its administrative offices in lakeville, ct.
change in value of swap agreement -2,513,680. CHANGE IN VALUE OF POST RETIREMENT BENEFIT OBLIGATION -5,669,445. CHANGE IN VALUE OF CRUTS -2,570,719.
The organization did not change its oversight or selection processes during the tax year.
